revised_title: Techniques and Applications of Archaeological Field Surveys
tldr: This article discusses various techniques used in archaeological field surveys, focusing on geophysical prospecting methods. It explains the basic aims and limitations of surface traces, air photography, sampling methods, and geophysical methods in discovering information about buried archaeological sites. The article provides examples of successful applications and outlines the general aspects of geophysical prospecting, emphasizing the importance of distinguishing meaningful physical contrasts and interpreting geophysical results.
